isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: If not previously installed, install the output yoke (or flange) and the output nut. Tighten the output nut to 610 to 677 Nm (450 to 500 ft-lbs).
Install the dowel pins to the proper depth 3/8 inch to 1/2 inch of the shoulder on the pins must be visible ( Figure 158).

note.para: Use crocus cloth to clean the dowel pins and dowel pin holes of all paint and corrosion. Apply a light coating of grease to the dowel pin holes.

step1.para: Make sure the auxiliary section is in low gear. If it is not, use one of two large screwdrivers or prybars to apply even rearward pressure to move the range sliding clutch back into the low gear position ( Figure 159).

figure.caption: Figure 159. Move Range Sliding Clutch Back Into Low Gear

step1.para: If the shift bar housing is installed, make sure the range bar lock cover is rotated counterclockwise into the unlock position ( Figure 160).
Position the gasket on the main case mounting surface.
Attach the auxiliary section hanger bracket to the top of the auxiliary section and attach the chain of the lifting device to the bracket ( Figure 161).
Allow the lifting device to support the weight of the auxiliary section, and position the auxiliary section on the two dowel pins. Slide the auxiliary section forward.

note.para: The range yoke bar must slide into the bore in the main case.
To help the auxiliary countershafts mesh with the auxiliary drive gear, rotate the output yoke to turn the gearing.
If the auxiliary countershafts drop excessively, the auxiliary countershaft shim tools can be used to support the countershafts.
The auxiliary section can be assembled to the transmission with the transmission in the vertical position.

step1.para: Remove the auxiliary section hanger bracket.

caution.para: Do not force or pull the auxiliary section into position with bolts when sliding it into place. It should slide into place fairly easily. If excessive force is necessary, the countershaft(s) is drooping and the gearing is not in proper mesh. Remove the auxiliary section and try again.

step1.para: Slide the auxiliary section fully into position.
Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the bolt threads and install the 19 bolts. Tighten them to 54 to 61 Nm (40 to 45 ft-lbs).

Remove the bolt securing the range bar lock cover in the unlock position and rotate the cover to the lock position. Insert the two bolts to secure the lock cover in position. Tighten them to 27 to 31 Nm (20 to 23 ft-lbs).

note.para: To properly align the lock cover, the auxiliary section must be in low range when the bolts are tightened.
